page.title: 19THE ASHBY CANAL
page.content: A section of the{Ashby-de-la-Zouch canal cuts through the eastern end of this block.The canal is very picturesque with its canal banks, abundance of reeds,wild life and hump bridges.It is a centre for {fishing,boating and rambling}along the towpath.This section is not used for transporting goods but as a pleasure cruising route. Sunday is a popular day for{fishing- pike,carp and tench being caught.Some black or white ducks are present. {Insects}noted are waterbeetles, mosquitoes,midges,ladybirds,hoverflies bluebottles and wasps.{Wildflowers noted include thistles,iris,cowparsley and{trees}include common and midland Hawthorn,Elder and some Ash. By{Basin Bridge}is a loop in the canal to facilitate the turning of boats.
